content.raw: Right, the color of the LED on the IR emitter can provide helpful visual feedback. From what I can tell, it should be dull green if it is connected and everything is configured correctly, and bright green when an app using stereo is running (e.g. glxgears or Gazebo with Ogre 3d). The problem I'm running into with haptix-osrf-02 is that everything appears to be configured correctly (I've replicated the steps in the Rviz stereo tutorial, which this tutorial is based on) and the light is dull green, but it never switches to dull green and I never see the blurry double image when I open glxgears or Gazebo.
content.html: Right, the color of the LED on the IR emitter can provide helpful visual feedback. From what I can tell, it should be dull green if it is connected and everything is configured correctly, and bright green when an app using stereo is running (e.g. glxgears or Gazebo with Ogre 3d). The problem I'm running into with haptix-osrf-02 is that everything appears to be configured correctly (I've replicated the steps in the Rviz stereo tutorial, which this tutorial is based on) and the light is dull green, but it never switches to dull green and I never see the blurry double image when I open glxgears or Gazebo.
